file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 27-51-18-04 - ROLLER PLUG - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL ROLLER PLUG - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the plugs of the rollers of the inboard and outboard flaps. B. These procedures are applicable to the eight plugs, on each side, as follows: • LH inboard flap: four plugs. • LH outboard flap: four plugs. • RH inboard flap: four plugs. • RH outboard flap: four plugs. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 27-51-18-000-801-A PLUG - REMOVAL ALL 27-51-18-400-801-A PLUG - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 27-51-18 Page 1 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 27-51-18-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. PLUG - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the plug of the flap roller. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 27-50-00-000-801-A/400 INBOARD FLAP - REMOVAL AMM TASK 27-50-00-000-802-A/400 OUTBOARD FLAP - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Bench I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Remove the LH or RH inboard or outboard flap (AMM TASK 27-50-00-000-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 27-50-00-000-802-A/400). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the thrust washer (retaining ring) to release the internal pin of the flap roller. (2) Put a rod with a diameter of 2.5 to 3.0 mm and a minimum length of 100 mm in the internal pin (1). (3) Push the rod against the plug (2). If necessary, carefully hit the end of the rod with a hammer. (4) Remove the plug (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-51-18 Page 2 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Plug - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B B A ZONES 532 541 B A DET. A ZONES B 632 ( TYP. ) 641 C ROD (REF.) 1. INTERNAL PIN FLAP ROLLER DET. B ( TYP. ) 2. PLUG DET. C 145AMM270213B.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-51-18 Page 3 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 27-51-18-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. PLUG - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the plug of the flap roller. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 27-50-00-400-801-A/400 INBOARD FLAP - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 27-50-00-400-802-A/400 OUTBOARD FLAP - INSTALLATION IPC 57-52-00 INBOARD FLAP IPC 57-53-00 OUTBOARD FLAP C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Plug (inboard flap) IPC 57-52-00 AR Plug (outboard flap) IPC 57-53-00 AR H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Bench I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the plug (2) in the end of the internal pin (1). (2) Push the plug (2) to install it. (3) Put the internal pin in the flap roller and install the thrust washer (retaining ring) EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 27-51-18 Page 4 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the LH or RH inboard or outboard flap ( AMM TASK 27-50-00-400-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 27-50-00-400-802-A/400).
